us_news:
• [Nov 25, 2:14 PM] FBI Investigation: Republican and Democratic attorneys general from 35 states and D.C. urged Congress not to block state laws regulating AI, warning of 'disastrous consequences' if the technology is left unregulated.
  • [Nov 25, 2:07 PM] White House/FBI: Reports indicate that President Donald Trump is considering the removal of Kash Patel as the director of the FBI in the coming months, citing three people familiar with the matter.
  • [Nov 25, 12:29 PM] Congressional Probe: The FBI has requested interviews with six Democratic U.S. lawmakers regarding a video message they released to military members, advising them that they can legally refuse to carry out unlawful orders.
  • [Nov 25, 2:00 PM] State Law/Abortion: Abortion has become illegal in North Dakota once again following a ruling by the state's Supreme Court, reversing a previous decision that had temporarily blocked the state's near-total ban.
  • [Nov 25, 12:00 PM] National Security/Foreign Policy: An opinion piece highlights a policy dilemma for the U.S. regarding the sale of F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia, and the ongoing debate over whether Turkey should be readmitted to the F-35 program.
  • [Nov 25, 8:30 AM] International/Human Rights: An opinion piece discusses the global movement to save the life of Hong Kong pro-democracy publisher Jimmy Lai, whose case, brought under a draconian national security law, has been raised by President Trump.
  • [Nov 24, 8:12 PM] Defense/Politics: The Pentagon has reportedly targeted Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) in a new development, as detailed in The Hill's Defense and National Security newsletter.
  • [Nov 24, 8:06 PM] House GOP Leadership: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's (R-Ga.) decision to resign from Congress has created a new political challenge for Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) and the already slim GOP majority in the House.
  • [Nov 24, 6:00 PM] Immigration/Courts: A federal appeals court upheld a ruling that blocks the Trump administration's plan for expedited removals of certain undocumented immigrants, maintaining the current legal standard.
  • [Nov 24, 5:10 PM] Healthcare/White House: The White House is reportedly preparing a health-policy framework that would propose extending Affordable Care Act (ACA) insurance premium subsidies for a period of two years.
financial_news:
• [Nov 25, 5:34 PM UTC] UK Stocks: UK stocks climbed on Tuesday, led by gains in financials and consumer staples, as investors positioned themselves ahead of Wednesday's expected tax-focused budget.
  • [Nov 25, 4:07 PM UTC] US Economic Data: U.S. business inventories were unexpectedly flat in August, a report showed, with stocks at retailers falling despite strong sales, suggesting a cautious inventory management approach.
  • [Nov 25, 1:27 PM UTC] UK Retail Confidence: British retailers reported the sharpest drop in confidence in 17 years, with sales falling, as the sector anticipates potential tax increases in the upcoming budget.
  • [Nov 25, 11:39 AM UTC] Global Markets/Fed Outlook: Global stocks climbed and US yields fell on elevated expectations for a Federal Reserve interest rate cut, with traders awaiting a new U.S. government consumer readout to test these hopes.
  • [Nov 24, 2:32 AM UTC] Crypto Market: Bitcoin (BTC) weakness persisted, with the cryptocurrency edging above $88,000 but lagging the broader rebound in US equities following a bruising selloff in the previous week.
conspiracies:
• [Nov 25, 12:34 PM] Theory: The CDC is embracing "bogus claims" of a link between vaccines and autism, a narrative being pushed by figures like Robert F. Kennedy Jr. (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 25, 12:27 PM] Theory: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., as a high-ranking official, is actively overturning public health rules, specifically rescinding a proposed rule to require asbestos testing in talc-containing products, which is being framed as an "anti-vaccine win." (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 25, 2:12 AM] Theory: The "Age of Disclosure" documentary, which claims 34 U.S. Government officials are revealing the truth about UFOs/UAPs, including the retrieval of "non-humans," is being widely promoted as a major step toward full disclosure. (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 22, 3:49 PM] Theory: A counter-narrative is trending within the UFO community, claiming that key figures like Lue Elizondo never led a UFO program and that famous UAP videos (Gimbal, Tic Tac) are explainable as glare or data vacuums, suggesting a "spook" disinformation campaign. (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 22, 3:15 PM] Theory: A new book, "Dead Ringer," is promoting a fresh take on the JFK assassination conspiracy, suggesting a new, hidden truth about the 62-year-old event is about to be revealed. (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 22, 11:45 AM] Theory: The "chem trail" conspiracy theory, which posits that governments are secretly spraying chemicals from planes for nefarious purposes (geoengineering, population control), is trending, with a focus on political figures who promote it. (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 21, 2:19 PM] Theory: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. personally instructed the CDC to abandon its longstanding position that vaccines do not cause autism, suggesting a high-level government effort to validate the discredited link. (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 21, 1:16 PM] Theory: The "Age of Disclosure" documentary is being hailed by major figures like Joe Rogan as one of the best documentaries on the UFO phenomenon, featuring high-ranking government officials revealing the truth about aliens and crashed craft. (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 21, 4:12 AM] Theory: The COVID-19 vaccine for children contained twice the concentration of a "cancer inducing SV40 promoter" as the adult version, which is being blamed for a supposed "explosion of childhood cancers." (Source: x.com)
  • [Nov 18, 10:00 AM] Theory: A controversial article in The Spectator is suggesting that the QAnon conspiracy theory was "right and good" and that Donald Trump's political journey was a pre-ordained "appointment with history," indicating a resurgence of QAnon narratives. (Source: x.com)
